captions.text: What is thy bidding, my master?
There is a great disturbance in the force.
I have felt it.
We have a new enemy.
I have no doubt. This boy is the offspring of Anakin Skywalker.
What? I have a son?
No, I said Anakin Skywalker has a son.
You are Darth Vad--
I have a son!! This is wonderful!
Wait..
I must see him!
Where are you going?
Hey everyone, have you heard the news?
I'm a father! WOOHOO!
I have a son, storm troopers! I have a son, asteroids!
Hey bounty hunters, guess what. I have a son. Did you know that?
I have a son, little droid that drives around the hallways.
I have a son, lightspeeeddd
This is amazing! I feel alive again. Me and my boy ruling the galaxy!
He's going to be so excited!
NNOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!
Noooo!!!

I know you're upset and its all a
little shocking...
but honestly I'm just so happy to finally meet you!
You cut off my hand!
Ahhh, don't be a baby, Luke.
I had both my arms and legs cut off.

As I was saying, join me and together
we can defeat
the emperor and rule the galaxy as father and son.
Hmmm..
That does sound pretty good.
But do we have to rule from the dark side?
Yes, that's how it works.
Then, I'll never join you.
See ya!

Oh, hold on! Where do you think you're
going?
Ah, come on!!
This is not a negotiation.
Let me go!
I am your father and I say we're going home.
You're the worst dad ever!
More like the most powerful dad ever! Hahaha

It just dawned on me that you are the
last trained Jedi.
Maybe you should not have let Luke go alone.
Hmmmmm...

Maybe getting cut in half for no reason,
you should not have!
Whoa, whoa! What are you doing?
You shot first.
Yea..
Why wouldn't I?
I uhhh...
I don't know the answer to that.

title: How The Empire Strikes Back Should Have Ended

comments.text:
Red Letter Media pointed out a massive plot hole with the prequels relating 
to this scene: Why would Obi Wan take Luke to Tatooine to be raised by his 
uncle in the exact same house that Anakin grew up in, when the whole point 
was to hide him from Vader? ﻿
comments.author: CosmicUndeadElf

comments.text:
+Frida Nyberg Red Media brings up valid points, but it is the extreme end 
of PT disdain, just as fanboys are the other end, denying problems with the 
PT, etc. Both sides go too far.
comments.author: Ian Barefoot

comments.text:
the shield generator has been hit! *Wait, if the shield generator has been 
hit, how can it been shot if there's a shield shielding them?* - that's a 
plothole!

anyway, the droid shot was not the evidence of trade galactic invasion, 
nothing was shown during that footage, only a droid getting shot at some 
space.. there's no sign of trade federation invasion army in that shot, 
only a couple of laser beam hitting a droid, it could be argued as pirate 
or anything..

why people can't love prequels for what they are? Yes they are flawed and 
not as good as original, but they had their moment too..

i still think Phantom Menace was the Nicest looking movie of all Star Wars, 
and i still think that Revenge of the Sith was more enjoyable than RoTJ and 
A New Hope. No hope for AoTC though..

does that mean i don't like original trilogy? off course not.. That 3 
movies are what got me hooked for star wars saga and i will never forget 
how luke fires that photon torpedoes and blew the hell out of that death 
star, i will never forget how vader surprises me with the twist, and i will 
never forget that leia's slave outfit.

If you really a fans of Star Wars, you will love all 6 movies. And soon 7..
comments.author: Daniel Cristofer Mendur

comments.text: Exactly my point.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes Yes but he was also a Sith Lord and Luke's father, so it 
stands to reason that they explore his back story in some kind of spiritual 
way. However, I think Lucas went the wrong way about it, Anakin did not 
need to be some kind of Jesus/Lucifer hybrid who the entire prequel trilogy 
revolved around.
comments.author: CosmicUndeadElf

comments.text:
+Kermit the Frog If you wish so, ok, I wont bash your favorite movies 
anymore. But I have to strongly disagree about Prophecy thing. Vader was 
evil, yes, but not a child murdering psychopat and certanly not some 
prophecy type guy. He was a fucking Nazi SS officer that did the job both 
behind the scenes and at the field when needed. Bringing up some prophecy 
shit is dumb and not needed without any pay off.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text: Aaaaand Mute Post!
comments.author: CosmicUndeadElf

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes YOU'RE SO FUCKING THICK. OH MY FUCKING GOD.
The Jedi were caught in a changing fucking galaxy, meaning they had to 
ADAPT TO IT, like GET INTO POLITICS. THE OLD JEDI WAY WAS CHANGED SO MUCH 
THE JEDI WAS MORE OF A MILITARY POWER. And for the last, FUCKING time, 
THEY. SERVE. THE. FUCKING. SENATE. YOU. DUMB. FUCK. THEY WEREN'T EVEN 
SUPPOSED TO BE ON NABOO YOU IDIOT, IF THEY WERE TO BE EXPOSED, IT WOULD 
RAISE A LOT OF CONTROVERSY.
They COULDN'T free the slaves because of the SAME. REASON. The Senate was 
already stretched too thin, because it's a SENATE. With SENATORS. 
Representing PLANETS which were their priorities. The Jedi likes to make 
themselves seem like the heroes when they were just another military.
I'M IN COMPLETE DENIAL? YOU'RE MAKING UP THE STUPIDEST SHIT TO MAKE THE 
MOVIES SEEM WORSE THAN THEY ACTUALLY ARE! YOU'RE BITCHING ABOUT SMALL 
THINGS I EXPLAINED MULTIPLE TIMES WHICH MOST PEOPLE PROBABLY DIDN'T NOTICE 
YOU DUNCE. Jango wasn't even a Seppie, they didn't know the Sith were 
involved, they just know that Jango wanted to kill Padme, but they never 
knew it's because the Sith hired him.
Anakin WAS good friends with Obi Wan, they were together for TEN YEARS. And 
Anakin was an AMAZING Jedi Knight. Did you forget he killed Dooku? Oh, of 
course you did, because that goes against your beliefs that anything that 
has to do with the prequels are bad.
The movie never INTENDED to give us the backstory, like the OT never 
intended to give us anything about the Jedi other than "no guys, really, 
they're good, trust us." It's "here's the bad guys, they're in a war, want 
to know more? look at other forms of media" JUST like the OT with anything 
Sith or Jedi related. Also the prophecy made Vader looked bad? You fucking 
joking? He blew up a planet after Leia TOLD them what they wanted to know 
and it made Vader look bad? He even fulfilled the prophecy at the end of 
RotJ!
Just stop talking. We have differing opinions about a movie and it's really 
getting out of hands. Lets just call this off, alright?
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
Nope. The fact they do not act and present the case to the senate is dumb 
in the first place, not to mention that Jedi should NOT CARE about 
politics, they are peacekeepers, guardians of truth and justice. Deal with 
it.
Yes, they should have freed the slaves, or at least made some ACTION about 
it in the senate (since you want them to involve themselves in the politics 
so much), but no, they never do that, they don't even go rescue Anakins MUM 
for Christ sake!
So WHAT? Are you fucking  kidding me? You are in complete denial about this 
movie. You lost all credibility for this discussion by this. SO WHAT? THEY 
FUCKING CONNECTED THE EVIDENCE! They KNEW Jango was involved, they knew his 
creation was used in the plot and they STILL WENT WITH IT. DUMB. No excuse.
Obi Wan said Anakin was a good friend and a great jedi knight. HE WAS NOT. 
He was fighting the same way as every other Jedi in the prequels, and he 
was bitching and whining all the time. We never saw a bond Anakin and Obi 
Wan were supposed to have, except a few lame jokes in the beginning of the 
third movie. Talk about bad character development..
No, it is not obvious. The movie never gives us their backstory, it just 
SAYS they want revenge. Are you that dumb that I need to repeat myself over 
this? WE NEED TO KNOW those things. We need to have a picture of what 
happened, we need someone to tell us. The word "sith" didnt even exist in 
the Originals, so if you are gonna pull it out of your ass in the prequel 
trilogy, YOU BETTER FUCKING EXPLAIN IT. Not to mention the dumb as fuck 
prophecy thing that even made Darth Vader in the OT look bad.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes Oh boy, still fighting a losing battle? 
Yes, Jedi serve the Republic politically, they are peacekeepers, but their 
job isn't to babysit planets, especially ones under a Trade Federation 
blockade, which was legal by the way. What do you expect them to do about 
slavery? Free every slave ever? They don't even control Tatooine. Again, 
they COULDN'T TELL THE TRUTH BECAUSE OF THE POLITICAL BACKFIRE IT WOULD 
MAKE. So what it the Jango was HIRED by the Seppies? They don't clone 
personality, they Clone appearance. 
No, Anakin was never part of the dark side before that. Not at all. "Oh, he 
was a little bit of a dick! That means he's evil!" Or, you know, he's 
arrogant, which is to be expected of a padawan. The first time you even saw 
him dipping into the Dark side was when he murdered the Tusken Raiders for 
killing his mother. In the originals Obi Wan says that Anakin was a great 
Jedi warrior who lost his way and became a Sith, so i don't have any idea 
where you got "hurrr durrrrr it contradicts the originals!" 
It's so fucking obvious why the Sith wanted revenge, and you have to be 
stupid to not see it. They say about six million times a movie what a Sith 
is, and they show multiple battles with the Sith, they even call them Sith 
during fight.
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
They could have, for the good of innocent people. But since these are Jedi 
from the prequel films, they care more about politics than saving others. A 
fail just by looking at that.
The Jedi do not SERVE the republic, they are guardians of TRUTH and JUSTICE 
in the galaxy. And what do they ever do to keep the truth and justice? 
Nothing, they dont give a shit about people being in slavery on Tatooine, 
they never tell the senate the truth about Naboo situation and only care 
about themselves. Bad. 
Jedi KNEW The Clones were ordered without permission, they KNEW the 
assassin was actually their original and that he was working for the 
separatists, so that is the massive plot hole that can never be redeemed.
Oh no, dont go there, Anakin was at the dark side already before that, he 
was a fucking asshole throughout both movies, his character is so fucked up 
and annoying that it completely mismatches with what we heard in the 
Originals about him.
No, they never EXPLAIN. They just say they want revenge for something we 
never find out. They never even claim if they are a race or a rank or 
whatever, they never say that they are actually dark jedi and they never 
give us their backstory except that boring as hell opera house scene were 
Ian McDiarmid looked bored as fuck while explaining some old Sith Lord that 
could prevent death. 
Counter-argumented again. Keep posting comments.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes I already explained it, but since you're skull is ten 
inches thick, lemme explain again. The Jedi COULDN'T interfere, because it 
would give the Republic bad publicity, and guess what? The Jedi SERVE THE 
REPUBLIC. Get it now, or do i need to explain it with sock puppets? The 
Republic didn't know the Clones were linked to the Seperatists, all they 
knew was that a Jedi ordered an army of them and they were clones of a 
bounty hunter. Padme cried because Anakin truly went over to the Dark side 
after hearing he killed younglings. Obi Wan wanted to know everything about 
the planet before he went to it, for all he knew it was filled with 
Seppies, so that's a fucking stupid "plothole" you pulled out of your ass. 
Again, the Republic didn't interfere because that would mean war, two Jedi 
there on unofficial business would be okay. The movie not telling us who 
the Sith are? What the actual fuck? They only explain it like a million 
times a movie, plus the three Sith in the prequels alone.
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
+Kermit the Frog I named you one for example only, and you failed to give a 
valid explanation. The fact that you need to think so much about it and 
come up with worst excuses tells enough about it. ;) Now let's bring up 
more examples shall we. 
There is no excuse for Padme being stupid and no excuse for Jedi not 
intervening, as there is no excuse for Republic using Clones after finding 
out they were linked to the separatists and the plot to kill Padme, as 
there was no logic in Padme not giving a shit about Anakin comitting 
genocide over a race in second movie, than crying when she hears he killed 
"younglings", as there is no logic in Obi-Wan wasting time screen in the 
library and with Yoda searching an answer that is so obvious even a child 
knows it and not just going to the fucking coordinates in the first place, 
as there is no excuse for not sending more Jedi to encounter Darth Maul on 
Naboo instead just two of them that already witnessed his capabilities, as 
there is no excuse for the movie not even telling us who the sith are, we 
just hear they want revenge and nothing else and then they even name a 
whole movie after them, lol. There you go.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes And yet, you fail to come up with any plot holes... 
Riiiight, and I'm the one thats failing xD you're hilarious
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
I like it how you feel the need to state that "you win" in an internet 
comment discussion, lol. 
Plot holes are related to the movies quality, and part of it is definitely 
not subjective. So stop failing and get over yourself. Movie is filled with 
those that an entire book could be written.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes We aren't even talking about the fucking quality of the 
movies, thats subjective, we were talking about plot holes, but you'ge 
obviously run out because now you started talking about somethi,g totally 
unrelated. Yeah, i win.
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
The sole fact that politics are involved so much in a Star Wars movie 
already makes it boring and fucked up. Talk about KIDS movie, no? But yea, 
keep convincing yourself otherwise, as if you can redeem these 3 awfully 
written movies. :)
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes When did they have footage of droids getting shot? And 
you think the POLITICIANS have nothing better to do, like, y'know, POLITICS 
that they believe. And again, if you READ what i said, i said they COULDN'T 
intervene even if they wanted to. Nice try, but you're wrong. Try again, 
maybe you'll get it right this time
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
They did have footage of droids getting shot. More important things? Like 
what? Sitting on their asses and doing nothing? They COULD do that, they do 
now answer to the chancellor, especially not if they witnessed invasion and 
suffering, they could have testified and made things simple. But no, plot 
convenience... Nice try tho.
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.text:
+myfavoritescenes 1. Obviously didn't have any footage
2.  They were not sent to Naboo by order of the Senate. They were secretly 
dispatched by the Chancellor who was mired in accusations of corruption. 
They could not report their findings as it would result in Valorum facing 
censorship or worse. 
3. Because they didn't believe her and thought they had much more important 
things to do
comments.author: Kermit the Frog

comments.text:
Explained in the movies not. In the EU, maybe. 
For example, how do you explain Padmes stupidity not to bring in videos 
from blockade to the senate as proof? Or bringing in the Jedi to testify? 
Or why not bring the comission with her at least if she was gonna go back 
in the first place?
comments.author: myfavoritescenes

comments.author: Ben Culture

comments.text:
+MegaKaitouKID1412 I said he should've been more zen-master, yes, but my 
only point there was that Anakin was taken at a younger age and trained by 
a much more... helpful... Jedi master. I understand that for his character 
arc he had to be a selfish little shit, but honestly the way he was 
portrayed never felt right to me.

He should've been the poster-boy who gave in to temptation and fell from 
power. It's just like RedLetterMedia said:
"In the prequels we hear Obi-Wan mention how he was 'a good friend' but we 
never get to see any kind of friendship between them, the entire trilogy 
shows them bickering and Anakin acting selfish and impulsive."

Before seeing the prequels, I'd always had the story in my head that 
Obi-Wan and Anakin were comrades, not master and apprentice. They were 
brothers in arms but the events of the Clone Wars ended up leading Anakin 
down a darker path.

Obviously this is all just my opinion, and I understand we both may have 
misunderstood each other. I apologize if I snapped a bit, I didn't intend 
to.
comments.author: Immortal Daevon

comments.text:
+Immortal Daevon You said he "should've been" zen master. I just said that 
he never reached a point where he would need to be zen master to get there, 
but did end up going down a path where he needs to be less zen master. I'm 
just saying with his eventual development, no, he shouldn't've been more 
zen master. Sorry if you misunderstood (it's been a long day, I might've 
worded it weird). I hate whiney Anakin too, but being a better jedi 
wouldn't be a solution to the problem of Anakin being a whiney bitch... at 
least without it ruining his fall into darkness.
comments.author: MegaKaitouKID1412

comments.text:
+MegaKaitouKID1412 Uh, I *never* said he was a zen master... because he 
*wasn't* a zen master, he was a whiny bitch throughout the entire prequel 
trilogy.

Quit putting words in my mouth.
comments.author: Immortal Daevon

comments.text:
+Immortal Daevon Anakin wasn't a master though. He was a knight... who 
turned to the dark side. A zen jedi master wouldn't do that-- or at least 
would need quite a lot of development to get to that point. So going from 
whiny kid to zen jedi master and then to the dark side? Why, when you can 
more believably go from whiny kid to the dark side without that huge middle 
step? Don't get me wrong, I hate whiney Anakin, but I don't think his 
character could at any point be the ideal jedi zen master that Luke 
developed towards or any of the masters were.
comments.author: MegaKaitouKID1412

comments.text:
+Immortal Daevon anakin is cocky, rush into things and can't control his 
emotions he is the exact opposite of what jedi is meant to be, obi won on 
the other hand is the jedi poster boy.
comments.author: jack lantern

comments.text:
+Elliot Wilson The difference is that wasn't writing, that was acting. 
Hamil's delivery was whiny because he was demonstrating Luke's character 
progression from whiny immature farm kid to calm, collected jedi knight. 
Hayden Christiansen was just written poorly. He started out a retarded 
immature kid in Ep II and ended a retarded, albiet angrier, immature kid in 
Ep III. Luke was a last-chance bid to make a jedi out of a kid who had his 
heart in the right place. Anakin should've been *more* ideal jedi zen 
master, not *less.*
comments.author: Immortal Daevon

comments.text:
+Ben Culture I know, yet people seem to forget that when blasting the 
prequels that Luke was just as whiny. "But I was going into Tosche Station 
to pick up some power converters!" "But it's whole 'nother year!" 
"NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!"
